schema.name: Healthyfied Mexican Ground Beef

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: Peel and mince the garlic, dice the capsicum green and red peppers, and finely chop the red onion.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground beef with salt, ground pepper, cumin, Spanish paprika, dried marjoram, oregano, and ground ginger. Mix thoroughly.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add the minced garlic and chopped onions, sautéing until they are soft and fragrant, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the seasoned ground beef to the skillet. Cook, breaking the meat apart with a spatula, until it is browned and cooked through, about 8-10 minutes.
Stir in the diced capsicum green and red peppers. Continue cooking for an additional 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Your Healthyfied Mexican Ground Beef is now ready to be enjoyed!

schema.description: Dive into the bold flavors of Mexico with this Healthyfied Mexican Ground Beef recipe! Designed for those seeking a high-protein and low-carb diet without sacrificing taste, this dish is perfect for anyone looking to enjoy the richness of Mexican cuisine in a healthier, low-sugar version. Infused with a blend of traditional spices, this recipe guarantees a delicious and satisfying meal, making it a must-try in your healthy recipe collection.
